articles.author: Sinead Cruise, Elena Fabrichnaya, Alexander Marrow
articles.description: Western investors in Russian companies are bracing for a new presidential decree under consideration in Moscow which they fear could force them to sell their shareholdings to the Russian government at big discounts.
articles.title: Western investors spooked as Moscow mulls compulsory share purchase plan

articles.author: Tetsushi Kajimoto
articles.description: Japanese exports grew for a second straight month in October but at a sharply slower pace due to slumping China-bound shipments of chips and steel, as weakening external demand takes its toll on the trade-reliant economy.
articles.title: Japan's export growth slows as China, global downturn risks loom

articles.author: Liangping Gao, Ryan Woo
articles.description: China's new home prices fell for the fourth straight month with dozens of cities hit by declines, the most since the peak of the COVID-19 pandemic last year, suggesting a broader weakening in the sector that could drag on the country's overall recovery.
articles.title: China's home prices dip for 4th month, may weaken further

articles.author: Supantha Mukherjee
articles.description: TikTok on Thursday joined Meta (META.O) in appealing against the "gatekeeper" status under the Digital Markets Act (DMA), an EU law that brings in tougher rules for tech companies and makes it easier for users to move between competing services.
articles.title: TikTok joins Meta in appealing against EU gatekeeper status

articles.author: Christoph Steitz, Alexander Hübner
articles.description: Siemens (SIEGn.DE) on Thursday gave a more cautious sales outlook for 2024 after the trains to industrial software maker reported fourth-quarter industrial profit ahead of expectations.
articles.title: Siemens expects sales growth to slow in 2024 after forecast-beating Q4

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain's Burberry (BRBY.L) said it was being hit by a global slowdown in luxury spending, and if it continued it was unlikely to meet its revenue forecast of low double-digit growth for its current financial year, with a knock-on impact on profit.
articles.title: Burberry says being hit by slowdown in luxury spending

articles.author: Rodrigo Campos
articles.description: Global investors expect a large amount of financial pain out of Argentina no matter who voters pick on Sunday as their next president, with social unrest as top of mind as a much-needed fiscal adjustment will likely trigger even more inflation.
articles.title: Argentina investors brace for financial pain no matter who wins presidency

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden meets Chinese leader Xi Jinping for the first time in a year on Wednesday, for talks that may ease friction between the adversarial superpowers on military conflicts, drug-trafficking and artificial intelligence.
articles.title: Biden, Xi meet as US-China military, economic tensions grind on

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: Israel said its forces were operating in and around Gaza's biggest hospital, a chief objective in its campaign to destroy Palestinian Hamas militants that the army says stored weapons and ran a command centre in tunnels beneath the buildings.
articles.title: Israeli troops deepen search at main Gaza hospital for evidence of Hamas

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Airbus (AIR.PA) and Emirates edged towards a consolation deal for a double-digit number of A350-900 jets on Thursday after a public row between the carrier and engine maker Rolls-Royce (RR.L) over a larger model dampened the end of the Dubai Airshow.
articles.title: Airbus nears compromise deal after Emirates jet order row
